result.execSummary:
The defendant Sherron Laqonda Sellers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to Kenneth K. in the stipulated amount of $1,055.68; restitution to be paid first.  Then pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of probationary period.  Should defendant get revoked and be sent to prison, Court ordered monies taken by the Department of Correction from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would be then be paid while on Extended Supervision.   Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
Obtain GED. Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

No contact with Kenneth K.
No contact with Potowatomi Bingo and Casino, 1721 West Canal Street, Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
No controlled substances or alcohol.

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Parenting classes/counseling.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
AODA assessment; treatment, if needed. Urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With Huber release to the Day Reporting Center (DRC) only; good time allowed.

records.addlTxt: Original GUILTY PLEA / SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (32 pages) commencing 06-15-2015 received and filed. CH

Attorney Bernard S. Stein in court, defendant Sherron Laqonda Sellers not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp  for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Stein has been appointed as counsel in this case.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date within the next week or so.  Victim notification must be made so a separate sentencing date may be needed.  Victim/Witness Unit notified of same.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sherron Laqonda Sellers in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Sherron Laqonda Sellers in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel before Branch 20.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  File retained in court.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Sherron Laqonda Sellers not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Sherron Laqonda Sellers not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling to go over offer with her client.  Court granted same and continued matter before Branch 20.  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sherron Laqonda Sellers in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Sherron Laqonda Sellers in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Kenneth K; Potowatomi Bingo and Casino.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sherron Laqonda Sellers in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  
Defendant Sherron Laqonda Sellers in custody.  
Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
